message: gevent or meinheld
meinheld?

I never heard of meinheld before, but it's here in pypi: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/meinheld/0.4.10    It says it's another asynchronous web server like gevent or tornado, but doesn't mention what unique about it.  If it's like gevent or tornado, why wouldn't you try gevent or tornado?  I don't get this :(
meinheld is a web server written in C so it's generally faster that the pure python counterparts.
This basically limits it to Unix though were file descriptors are a positive integer (picoev exploits this to gain speed)
meinheld also uses picoev while gevent uses libevent. picoenv was generally shown to be faster.
http://developer.cybozu.co.jp/kazuho/2009/08/picoev-a-tiny-e.html

"Why is it faster?  It is because it uses an array and a ring buffer of bit vectors as its internal structure.  Libevent and libev seem to use some kind of sorted tree to represent file descriptors.  "
So picoev and this meinheld will probably never work on non unix systems (unless meinheld starts using a different event library)
BTW, the author of meinheld is @mopemope
I also never heard of meinheld.  Looks interesting.
i'd love to try out meinheld, but it complains and says it supports only linux, so I can't seem to get it installed on my macbook. Any suggestions?
@mattg You can try the dev branch. @mopemope says it should be working but he hasn't tried it himself.
cool, thanks
gevent here
How much would the difference between libevent and picoev actually improve things with a real app that does things like database I/O, file I/O, etc?

last version of gevent started to move to libev. I'm not sure about differences between picoev and libev soud like for filessyteme, both are missing possibilities you find in libeio (http://software.schmorp.de/pkg/libeio.html) .
But then, a lot of us could probably get by with lower timer resolution also. <shrug>. If you play with it and get numbers please share :).

@antihero With high concerrency picoev sacrifices timer resolution. That's the only downside. But also, gevent/libevent is *very* speedy. If you need crazy good latency  maybe it's worth considering picoev (maybe high speed trading, if anyone does this in python). I have a hard time believing it's necessary for consumer anything though.
libev is known for a better usage of kernel possibilities
pretty sure that last gevent version that use libev instead libevent will decrease latency

WOW. Just messed around with meinheld, doing some simple ab benchmarking, it's amazing. gunicorn --workers=2 --worker-class="egg:meinheld#gunicorn_worker" gunicorn_test:app with ab -c 100 -n 1000 and I'm getting 20,000 req/s in osx.
w/o meinheld I get around 6000-7000 req/s
results from my simple benching: http://paste.pound-python.org/show/5933/
would be interresting to speed the gevent worker. Not sure if using libev improve latency or not
